Posted By: WhiteyMcFly (7/7/2011 7:41:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm glad to see this card return. [Overwhelming Stampede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overwhelming Stampede) I thought always played like a win-more card because you got the best effect out of it when you already had a fat creature on the board. Overrun, on the other hand, is a great surprise card because it turns your completely non-threatening crew of dorks into an unstoppable killing machine, even if they happen to all start out with 0 or 1 power. Overrun will always be my favorite finisher.
posts.html:
I'm glad to see this card return. Overwhelming Stampede I thought always played like a win-more card because you got the best effect out of it when you already had a fat creature on the board. Overrun, on the other hand, is a great surprise card because it turns your completely non-threatening crew of dorks into an unstoppable killing machine, even if they happen to all start out with 0 or 1 power. Overrun will always be my favorite finisher.

Posted By: The_Trendkill (8/12/2011 10:18:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Man, I LOVE Overrun!  
It's so great when you've got your [Runeclaw Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runeclaw Bear)s and your [Spined Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spined Wurm)s and even the little tiny [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves)   
and then you're like,   
"\*\*\*, OVERRUN!"  
And they is like, "aww HEEELLLL NAW!"  
  
And you win :D  
  
Although, in retrospect, [Overwhelming Stampede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overwhelming Stampede) is better....  
Again, however, in hindsight, Overrun is an uncommon, so it's more accessible and easier to get for the less-experienced.
